**铁头木棒**（quarterstaff）是[NetHack](/index.php?title=NetHack/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "NetHack/zh-CN (page does not exist)")中的一种[武器](/wiki/%E6%AD%A6%E5%99%A8 "武器")。它是[双手](/index.php?title=%E5%8F%8C%E6%89%8B\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "双手 (page does not exist)")武器，以木头制成，且未鉴定时，它的外观为**棒子**（staff）。

[阿斯克勒庇俄斯之杖](/index.php?title=%E9%98%BF%E6%96%AF%E5%85%8B%E5%8B%92%E5%BA%87%E4%BF%84%E6%96%AF%E4%B9%8B%E6%9D%96\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "阿斯克勒庇俄斯之杖 (page does not exist)")是一种[神器](/index.php?title=%E7%A5%9E%E5%99%A8%E6%AD%A6%E5%99%A8\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "神器武器 (page does not exist)")类铁头木棒。

## 生成

[巫师](/index.php?title=%E5%B7%AB%E5%B8%88\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "巫师 (page does not exist)")在游戏开始时会获得一把[祝福](/index.php?title=%E7%A5%9D%E7%A6%8F\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "祝福 (page does not exist)")的+1铁头木棒[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)。

铁头木棒在随机生成武器中占比1.1%。[大巫妖](/index.php?title=%E5%A4%A7%E5%B7%AB%E5%A6%96\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "大巫妖 (page does not exist)")生成时有2⁄9的概率获得一把铁头木棒，但由于它没有武器攻击能力，所以并不会将其用于战斗[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)。

所有[玩家怪物](/index.php?title=%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "玩家怪物 (page does not exist)")生成时有约1%的概率获得一把铁头木棒[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)。[医生职业的玩家怪物](/index.php?title=%E5%8C%BB%E7%94%9F%EF%BC%88%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "医生（玩家怪物） (page does not exist)")的起始武器有3⁄4的概率被替换为铁头木棒。[巫师职业的玩家怪物](/index.php?title=%E5%B7%AB%E5%B8%88%EF%BC%88%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "巫师（玩家怪物） (page does not exist)")（包括[巫师任务](/index.php?title=%E5%B7%AB%E5%B8%88%E4%BB%BB%E5%8A%A1\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "巫师任务 (page does not exist)")的Newt）的起始武器有3⁄8的概率被替换成铁头木棒[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)。

[木魔像](/index.php?title=%E6%9C%A8%E9%AD%94%E5%83%8F\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "木魔像 (page does not exist)")被摧毁时会掉落2～8根铁头木棒[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)。

*以下内容涉及即将到来的版本（[3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")）之信息。如果该版本已发布，请验证此处信息是否准确，并作出相应修改，以将其并入页面。*

现在木魔像也能掉落其他木质物品了。

| 老练   | - [穴居人](/index.php?title=%E7%A9%B4%E5%B1%85%E4%BA%BA\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "穴居人 (page does not exist)")、[医生](/index.php?title=%E5%8C%BB%E7%94%9F\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "医生 (page does not exist)")、[牧师](/index.php?title=%E7%89%A7%E5%B8%88\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "牧师 (page does not exist)")、[巫师](/index.php?title=%E5%B7%AB%E5%B8%88\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "巫师 (page does not exist)")                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

铁头木棒是唯一使用铁头木棒技能的武器。

## 策略

铁头木棒对于巫师来说足够实用，但在常规战斗中实用度不及其他双手武器（如[战斧](/wiki/%E6%88%98%E6%96%A7 "战斧")或[双手剑](/wiki/%E5%8F%8C%E6%89%8B%E5%89%91 "双手剑")）。巫师在前期仍可能需要考虑附魔它们以加大生存率。

*以下内容涉及即将到来的版本（[3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")）之信息。如果该版本已发布，请验证此处信息是否准确，并作出相应修改，以将其并入页面。*

根据[commit 780d30ec](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/780d30eca99a607fefee8e0fc8e66692d06dfea5)，持握诅咒的铁头木棒不再阻止施法。根据[commit 780d30ec](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/780d30eca99a607fefee8e0fc8e66692d06dfea5)，持握铁头木棒还能小幅提升施法成功率。

## 历史

铁头木棒最初于[NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0")加入。

巫师的初始武器在[NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0")中替换为铁头木棒，这发生于将[巫师补丁](/index.php?title=%E5%B7%AB%E5%B8%88%E8%A1%A5%E4%B8%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "巫师补丁 (page does not exist)")合入3.2.X版本游戏的主分支的过程中——在[NetHack 3.2.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.2.3 "NetHack 3.2.3")及更早版本，巫师的起始武器是+1[仪式刀](/wiki/%E4%BB%AA%E5%BC%8F%E5%88%80 "仪式刀")。这是为了在施法系统更新后平衡巫师过强的实力，因为更新后法术几乎能够无限制地施放。这也弱化了巫师在游戏早期刻写半永久[Elbereth](/index.php?title=Elbereth/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Elbereth/zh-CN (page does not exist)")的能力（这仍然可以做到，但需要开局时获得特定的魔杖，并且会受魔杖充能数的限制）。

## Variants

**此条目或段落的部分内容需要翻译。**  
您可以帮助我们[**翻译此页面**](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Quarterstaff/zh-CN\&action=edit)，但**请勿使用机器翻译**。

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [Flame Mages](/wiki/Flame_Mage "Flame Mage"), [Ice Mages](/wiki/Ice_Mage "Ice Mage") and [Necromancers](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer") also start with a blessed +1 quarterstaff.

The [double lightsaber](/wiki/Lightsaber "Lightsaber") is a new weapon that uses the quarterstaff skill. SLASH'EM's version of the [Lethe patch](/wiki/Lethe_patch "Lethe patch"), [SLethe](/wiki/SLethe "SLethe"), also adds a [silver-capped staff](/index.php?title=Silver-capped_staff\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Silver-capped staff (page does not exist)") that deals additional damage against [silver-hating](/wiki/Silver-hating "Silver-hating") monsters.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), there are [spell staves](/wiki/Spell_staves "Spell staves") for every school of magic except [enchantment spells](/wiki/Enchantment_spells "Enchantment spells"). These staves are all made of wood, and boost the cast rates of spells for their respective spell schools - this is done to make certain types of magic more viable for various casting playstyles that would have difficulty using them otherwise. The bonus given is a flat +50% spell success chance, applied after all other checks besides the check for body armor.

- [Staves of divination](/index.php?title=Staff_of_divination\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Staff of divination (page does not exist)") aid in the casting of [divination spells](/wiki/Divination_spell "Divination spell") while wielded.
- [Staves of escape](/index.php?title=Staff_of_escape\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Staff of escape (page does not exist)") aid in the casting of [escape spells](/wiki/Escape_spell "Escape spell") while wielded.
- [Staves of healing](/index.php?title=Staff_of_healing\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Staff of healing (page does not exist)") aid in the casting of [healing spells](/wiki/Healing_spell "Healing spell") while wielded.
- [Staves of holiness](/index.php?title=Staff_of_holiness\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Staff of holiness (page does not exist)") aid in the casting of [clerical spells](/wiki/Clerical_spell "Clerical spell") while wielded.
- [Staves of matter](/index.php?title=Staff_of_matter\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Staff of matter (page does not exist)") aid in the casting of [matter spells](/wiki/Matter_spell "Matter spell") while wielded.
- [Staves of battle](/index.php?title=Staff_of_battle\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Staff of battle (page does not exist)") aid in the casting of [attack spells](/wiki/Attack_spell "Attack spell") while wielded.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), cutting down a tree will leave behind 1-3 quarterstaves and/or [clubs](/wiki/Club "Club").

A very burnt quarterstaff can be found along with the corpse of a wizard and a burnt [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe") on the second level of the [Ruins of Moria](/wiki/Ruins_of_Moria "Ruins of Moria"); this is a clear homage to the wizard Gandalf from [J.R.R. Tolkien](/wiki/J.R.R._Tolkien "J.R.R. Tolkien")'s works set in Middle-Earth.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds additional weapons that use the quarterstaff skill:

- The [khakkhara](/wiki/Khakkhara "Khakkhara") does less base damage against large monsters, but is made of silver; khakkharas additionally deal more damage to holy- and unholy-haters (depending on [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude")): the bonus damage is rolled [1d3](/wiki/D_notation "D notation") times.
- The [iron bar](/wiki/Iron_bar "Iron bar") does more base damage to small monsters, but is not randomly generated and only appears upon destroying a set of [iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars").
- The double lightsaber is somewhat similar to its appearance in SLASH'EM, and is also known as a double force-blade.

The [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") [Naberius](/wiki/Naberius "Naberius") grants skill in quarterstaff while bound.

The [adventuring wizard](/wiki/Adventuring_wizard "Adventuring wizard") of the enemy party that collectively acts as the default [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble") quest nemesis will always generates with a quarterstaff.

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), a wielded quarterstaff increases the success rate of [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting"), similar to a [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe").

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), a wielded quarterstaff improves spellcasting, and a cursed quarterstaff that is welded to a character's hands does not block spellcasting.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the quarterstaff provides the same benefits as in FIQHack, improving spellcasting success rates and not blocking casting if wielded while cursed. This effect does not stack with other items that provide the same benefit (i.e., the robe and the [wand of nothing](/wiki/Wand_of_nothing "Wand of nothing")).

### SpliceHack

In pre-[Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite") [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [The Power Pole](/wiki/The_Power_Pole "The Power Pole") is an artifact quarterstaff that acts as the [Dancer](/wiki/Dancer "Dancer") quest artifact.

### notdNetHack

In addition to dNetHack details, [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") adds [the Poplar Punisher](/wiki/The_Poplar_Punisher "The Poplar Punisher"), an artifact quarterstaff that has +1d4 to-hit and +2d6 damage.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") incorporates the spell staves from SporkHack, with some changes made to a few of the staves:

- Staves of holiness are made of [bone](/wiki/Bone "Bone").
- Staves of matter are made of [adamantine](/wiki/Adamantine "Adamantine"), making them lighter compared to the other staves.
- The staff of battle is renamed to the staff of war, and is now made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") - this makes it heavier than its counterparts, but also grants it an extra +d2 to-hit.

In addition, the [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") of [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane") is changed to a quarterstaff.

EvilHack also introduces [The Staff of the Archmagi](/wiki/The_Staff_of_the_Archmagi "The Staff of the Archmagi"), an artifact [ashwood staff](/wiki/Ashwood_staff "Ashwood staff") that uses the skill and is created by combining Magicbane and [Secespita](/wiki/Secespita "Secespita") at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)"). The ashwood staff as a base item deals more damage than a standard quarterstaff.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, the [Acid Mage](/wiki/Acid_Mage "Acid Mage") and [Electric Mage](/wiki/Electric_Mage "Electric Mage") also start with a blessed +1 quarterstaff. SlashTHEM introduces [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") quarterstaves as well:

- [Shimmerstaff](/index.php?title=Shimmerstaff\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shimmerstaff (page does not exist)") is an artifact silver-capped staff and the first guaranteed [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for the [Bard](/wiki/Bard "Bard").
- The [Cudgel of Cuthbert](/index.php?title=Cudgel_of_Cuthbert\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Cudgel of Cuthbert (page does not exist)") is an artifact quarterstaff and the [Chevalier](/wiki/Chevalier "Chevalier") quest artifact.
- [The Staff of Withering](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Withering "The Staff of Withering") is an artifact quarterstaff and the [Lunatic](/wiki/Lunatic "Lunatic") quest artifact.

SlashTHEM also incorporates the Noble role, with the adventuring wizard and his party serving the same roles.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") incorporates spell staves as implemented in EvilHack, with some additional changes made:

- Staves of matter are made of [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril"), as in earlier versions of EvilHack.
- The staff of holiness is replaced with the [staff of necromancy](/index.php?title=Staff_of_necromancy\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Staff of necromancy (page does not exist)"), due to using SLASH'EM spell school categories. Staves of necromancy are made of bone.

Some artifact weapons additionally use the quarterstaff skill, and have their [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") changed from other variants:

- [The Staff of Rot](/index.php?title=The_Staff_of_Rot\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Staff of Rot (page does not exist)") is a staff of necromancy that deals [withering](/wiki/Withering "Withering") damage actively and passively.
- [Firewall](/wiki/Firewall "Firewall") is a staff of divination that grants [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") and deals fire damage, and is the first sacrifice gift for [Flame Mages](/wiki/Flame_Mage "Flame Mage").
- [Circe's Witchstaff](/index.php?title=Circe%27s_Witchstaff\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Circe's Witchstaff (page does not exist)") is a staff of matter that can turn enemies into pigs.
- The [Drowsing Rod](/index.php?title=Drowsing_Rod\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drowsing Rod (page does not exist)") is a staff of healing that can put enemies to [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") with its sleeping gas attack, and is the first sacrifice gift for Healers.
- [Origin](/index.php?title=Origin\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Origin (page does not exist)") is a staff of escape that confers [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control") and spellcasting bonuses while wielded.

## 百科文本

So they stood, each in his place, neither moving a finger's  
breadth back, for one good hour, and many blows were given  
and received by each in that time, till here and there were  
sore bones and bumps, yet neither thought of crying "Enough,"  
or seemed likely to fall from off the bridge. Now and then  
they stopped to rest, and each thought that he never had seen  
in all his life before such a hand at quarterstaff. At last  
Robin gave the stranger a blow upon the ribs that made his  
jacket smoke like a damp straw thatch in the sun. So shrewd  
was the stroke that the stranger came within a hair's breadth  
of falling off the bridge; but he regained himself right  
quickly, and, by a dexterous blow, gave Robin a crack on the  
crown that caused the blood to flow. Then Robin grew mad  
with anger, and smote with all his might at the other; but  
the stranger warded the blow, and once again thwacked Robin,  
and this time so fairly that he fell heels over head into the  
water, as the queen pin falls in a game of bowls.

\[ The Merry Adventures of Robin Hood, by Howard Pyle ]

名称 铁头木棒
外观 棒子
伤害（小型） 1d6
伤害（大型） 1d6
命中修正 +0
武器技能类别 铁头木棒

基础价 5 zm
（+10/正数附魔等级）
重量 40
材料 木头

铁头木棒（quarterstaff）是NetHack中的一种武器。它是双手武器，以木头制成，且未鉴定时，它的外观为棒子（staff）。

阿斯克勒庇俄斯之杖是一种神器类铁头木棒。

Contents

  • 1 生成
  • 2 铁头木棒技能
  • 3 策略
  • 4 历史
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM

    • 5.3 UnNetHack
    • 5.4 dNetHack

    • 5.7 xNetHack

    • 5.9 notdNetHack

    • 5.12 Hack'EM
  • 6 百科文本
  • 7 引用及注释

生成

巫师在游戏开始时会获得一把祝福的+1铁头木棒[1]。

铁头木棒在随机生成武器中占比1.1%。大巫妖生成时有2⁄9的概率获得一把铁头木棒，但由于它没有武器攻击能力，所以并不会将其用于战斗[2][3]。

所有玩家怪物生成时有约1%的概率获得一把铁头木棒[4]。医生职业的玩家怪物的起始武器有3⁄4的概率被替换为铁头木棒。巫师职业的玩家怪物（包括巫师任务的Newt）的起始武器有3⁄8的概率被替换成铁头木棒[5][6]。

木魔像被摧毁时会掉落2～8根铁头木棒[7]。

以下内容涉及即将到来的版本（3.7.0）之信息。如果该版本已发布，请验证此处信息是否准确，并作出相应修改，以将其并入页面。

现在木魔像也能掉落其他木质物品了。

铁头木棒技能

铁头木棒
最大等级 角色
基础
  • 野蛮人、僧侣、游侠、武士、游客、女武神
熟练
  • 考古学家
老练
  • 穴居人、医生、牧师、巫师

铁头木棒是唯一使用铁头木棒技能的武器。

策略

铁头木棒对于巫师来说足够实用，但在常规战斗中实用度不及其他双手武器（如战斧或双手剑）。巫师在前期仍可能需要考虑附魔它们以加大生存率。

以下内容涉及即将到来的版本（3.7.0）之信息。如果该版本已发布，请验证此处信息是否准确，并作出相应修改，以将其并入页面。

根据commit 780d30ec，持握诅咒的铁头木棒不再阻止施法。根据commit 780d30ec，持握铁头木棒还能小幅提升施法成功率。

历史

铁头木棒最初于NetHack 3.0.0加入。

巫师的初始武器在NetHack 3.3.0中替换为铁头木棒，这发生于将巫师补丁合入3.2.X版本游戏的主分支的过程中——在NetHack 3.2.3及更早版本，巫师的起始武器是+1仪式刀。这是为了在施法系统更新后平衡巫师过强的实力，因为更新后法术几乎能够无限制地施放。这也弱化了巫师在游戏早期刻写半永久Elbereth的能力（这仍然可以做到，但需要开局时获得特定的魔杖，并且会受魔杖充能数的限制）。

Variants

此条目或段落的部分内容需要翻译。
您可以帮助我们翻译此页面，但请勿使用机器翻译。

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, Flame Mages, Ice Mages and Necromancers also start with a blessed +1 quarterstaff.

The double lightsaber is a new weapon that uses the quarterstaff skill. SLASH'EM's version of the Lethe patch, SLethe, also adds a silver-capped staff that deals additional damage against silver-hating monsters.

SporkHack

In SporkHack, there are spell staves for every school of magic except enchantment spells. These staves are all made of wood, and boost the cast rates of spells for their respective spell schools - this is done to make certain types of magic more viable for various casting playstyles that would have difficulty using them otherwise. The bonus given is a flat +50% spell success chance, applied after all other checks besides the check for body armor.

  • Staves of divination aid in the casting of divination spells while wielded.
  • Staves of escape aid in the casting of escape spells while wielded.
  • Staves of healing aid in the casting of healing spells while wielded.
  • Staves of holiness aid in the casting of clerical spells while wielded.
  • Staves of matter aid in the casting of matter spells while wielded.
  • Staves of battle aid in the casting of attack spells while wielded.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, cutting down a tree will leave behind 1-3 quarterstaves and/or clubs.

A very burnt quarterstaff can be found along with the corpse of a wizard and a burnt robe on the second level of the Ruins of Moria; this is a clear homage to the wizard Gandalf from J.R.R. Tolkien's works set in Middle-Earth.

dNetHack

dNetHack adds additional weapons that use the quarterstaff skill:

  • The khakkhara does less base damage against large monsters, but is made of silver; khakkharas additionally deal more damage to holy- and unholy-haters (depending on beatitude): the bonus damage is rolled 1d3 times.
  • The iron bar does more base damage to small monsters, but is not randomly generated and only appears upon destroying a set of iron bars.
  • The double lightsaber is somewhat similar to its appearance in SLASH'EM, and is also known as a double force-blade.

The spirit Naberius grants skill in quarterstaff while bound.

The adventuring wizard of the enemy party that collectively acts as the default Noble quest nemesis will always generates with a quarterstaff.

NetHack Fourk

In NetHack Fourk, a wielded quarterstaff increases the success rate of spellcasting, similar to a robe.

FIQHack

In FIQHack, a wielded quarterstaff improves spellcasting, and a cursed quarterstaff that is welded to a character's hands does not block spellcasting.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the quarterstaff provides the same benefits as in FIQHack, improving spellcasting success rates and not blocking casting if wielded while cursed. This effect does not stack with other items that provide the same benefit (i.e., the robe and the wand of nothing).

SpliceHack

In pre-Rewrite SpliceHack, The Power Pole is an artifact quarterstaff that acts as the Dancer quest artifact.

notdNetHack

In addition to dNetHack details, notdNetHack adds the Poplar Punisher, an artifact quarterstaff that has +1d4 to-hit and +2d6 damage.

EvilHack

EvilHack incorporates the spell staves from SporkHack, with some changes made to a few of the staves:

  • Staves of holiness are made of bone.
  • Staves of matter are made of adamantine, making them lighter compared to the other staves.
  • The staff of battle is renamed to the staff of war, and is now made of iron - this makes it heavier than its counterparts, but also grants it an extra +d2 to-hit.

In addition, the base item of Magicbane is changed to a quarterstaff.

EvilHack also introduces The Staff of the Archmagi, an artifact ashwood staff that uses the skill and is created by combining Magicbane and Secespita at a forge. The ashwood staff as a base item deals more damage than a standard quarterstaff.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, the Acid Mage and Electric Mage also start with a blessed +1 quarterstaff. SlashTHEM introduces artifact weapon quarterstaves as well:

  • Shimmerstaff is an artifact silver-capped staff and the first guaranteed sacrifice gift for the Bard.
  • The Cudgel of Cuthbert is an artifact quarterstaff and the Chevalier quest artifact.
  • The Staff of Withering is an artifact quarterstaff and the Lunatic quest artifact.

SlashTHEM also incorporates the Noble role, with the adventuring wizard and his party serving the same roles.

Hack'EM

Hack'EM incorporates spell staves as implemented in EvilHack, with some additional changes made:

  • Staves of matter are made of mithril, as in earlier versions of EvilHack.
  • The staff of holiness is replaced with the staff of necromancy, due to using SLASH'EM spell school categories. Staves of necromancy are made of bone.

Some artifact weapons additionally use the quarterstaff skill, and have their base item changed from other variants:

  • The Staff of Rot is a staff of necromancy that deals withering damage actively and passively.
  • Firewall is a staff of divination that grants fire resistance and deals fire damage, and is the first sacrifice gift for Flame Mages.
  • Circe's Witchstaff is a staff of matter that can turn enemies into pigs.
  • The Drowsing Rod is a staff of healing that can put enemies to sleep with its sleeping gas attack, and is the first sacrifice gift for Healers.
  • Origin is a staff of escape that confers teleport control and spellcasting bonuses while wielded.

百科文本

So they stood, each in his place, neither moving a finger's
breadth back, for one good hour, and many blows were given
and received by each in that time, till here and there were
sore bones and bumps, yet neither thought of crying "Enough,"
or seemed likely to fall from off the bridge. Now and then
they stopped to rest, and each thought that he never had seen
in all his life before such a hand at quarterstaff. At last
Robin gave the stranger a blow upon the ribs that made his
jacket smoke like a damp straw thatch in the sun. So shrewd
was the stroke that the stranger came within a hair's breadth
of falling off the bridge; but he regained himself right
quickly, and, by a dexterous blow, gave Robin a crack on the
crown that caused the blood to flow. Then Robin grew mad
with anger, and smote with all his might at the other; but
the stranger warded the blow, and once again thwacked Robin,
and this time so fairly that he fell heels over head into the
water, as the queen pin falls in a game of bowls.

[ The Merry Adventures of Robin Hood, by Howard Pyle ]
